block.p: Warner Music Group, a division of Time Warner, and Bertelsmann's BMG Entertainment unit settled a copyright lawsuit with the online music Web site MP3.com.

The agreement permits MP3.com to store the record libraries of consumers and provides them access to the music over the Internet. MP3.com will pay about $20 million to each company along with licensing fees for use of the labels' music on the service.
Warner Music Group, a division of Time Warner, and Bertelsmann's BMG Entertainment unit settled a copyright lawsuit with the online music Web site MP3.com.

The agreement permits MP3.com to store the record libraries of consumers and provides them access to the music over the Internet. MP3.com will pay about $20 million to each company along with licensing fees for use of the labels' music on the service.

Three other major record labels, Sony Music, EMI and Universal Music Group, said they were continuing independent settlement negotiations with MP3.com. If they also settle for around $20 million each, as industry analysts expect, the cost to MP3.com could be $100 million or more.
